greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest permutation of primes such that a(n) = 2^n - 1 when n is one of the Mersenne prime exponents (in A000043).
comment: Sequence is well-defined also in case there are only a finite number of Mersenne primes.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3217
formula: For all applicable n >= 1, a(A000043(n)) = A000668(n).
example: For p in A000043: 2, 3, 5, 7, 13, 17, 19, ..., a(p) = (2^p)-1, thus a(2) = 2^2 - 1 = 3, a(3) = 7, a(5) = 31, a(7) = 127, a(13) = 8191, a(17) = 131071, etc., with the rest of positions filled by the least unused prime:
program: A332211list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to), xs=Map(), i=1, q); for(n=1,up_to, if(isprime(q=((2^n)-1)), v[n] = q, while(mapisdefined(xs,prime(i)), i++); v[n] = prime(i)); mapput(xs,v[n],n)); (v); };
\\ For faster computing of larger values, use precomputed values of A000043:

A332211list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to), xs=Map(), i=1, q); for(n=1,up_to, if(vecsearch(v000043,n), q = (2^n)-1, while(mapisdefined(xs,prime(i)), i++); q = prime(i)); v[n] = q; mapput(xs,q,n)); (v); };
xref: Cf. A000040, A000043, A000668, A332210 (inverse permutation of primes), A332220.
Used to construct permutations A332212, A332214.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 09 2020
